intro: Habracanthus pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramid bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
